title: Describing the Distribution
question_text:
X123456
P(X)0.040.110.330.350.140.03


A local police officer gives out between $1$ and $6\text{ tickets a day}$, the probability distribution table of which is shown above, where $X$ is the number of tickets handed out on any given day.
One can describe this distribution as...

choices.text:
Approximately normal, with a center of
3.5
.

A distribution with a center of about
3.5
, but describing the distribution using shape does not make sense in this situation.

Uniform with a center of
3
or
4
; one must give integer values for center since a police officer cannot give out a non-integer amount of tickets on a given day.

Approximately normal, with a center of
3
or
4
; one must give integer values for center since a police officer cannot give out a non-integer amount of tickets on a given day.
